text: Preparing the Fruit Cut the apples. Core each apple and cut them into slices. For the green apple, it is optional to leave the skin on or peel off before cutting. Peel the bananas. Cut them into bite-sized slices. Be sure the pieces are big enough so a toothpick can hold it. Prepare the strawberries. Decide if you want to present them whole or sliced. Rinse the strawberries gently and hull them (cut off the tops). Peel the oranges. Slice them into wedges. Cut the pineapple(s). Cut off the top and skin. Slice the pineapple into bite-sized cubes. Sprinkle lemon juice on the fruits. To avoid browning, it is highly recommended to sprinkle or spritz lemon juice on the apples and banana slices. Preparing the Alcohol and Arrangement Decide how to present the alcohol. Single or double shot glasses are suggested, or small bowls can accompany many guests or if you do not have shot glasses. Plate the fruit. Either line them on one plate or have different plates for each fruit. Use toothpicks to prod the fruit. Dip a fruit piece into the desired alcohol and enjoy.
